Deficiency Narrative: A staff member was left alone during awake hours, and did not adhere to the safety plan.
Correction Narrative: Children and staff were interviewed and confirmed that there are two staff at all time at the operation.  The safety plan will remain in place.  The safety plans are located in a book that is available for all staff. The staff also signs that they have read each child's plan that they understand it.

Deficiency Narrative: The caregiver did not follow the service plan for children that required line of sight supervision.
Correction Narrative: The staff indicated that they were retrained on service plans and ensuring that they are aware of each child's supervision plan.

Deficiency Narrative: The caregiver did not provide adequate supervision when the children were engaging inappropriate activities.
Correction Narrative: The children indicated that they are not left alone or unsupervised.  The staff confirmed that there are two staff to ensure there is a caregiver at all times with the children.

Deficiency Narrative: The caregiver did not report an incident to the hotline within the timeframe required.
Correction Narrative: The staff that were interviewed confirmed that there was a staff meeting on 12/23/24 that the Administrator went over reporting and they had to complete the reporting training again.

Deficiency Narrative: One medication log did not have the staff signature that administered the medication.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the Administrator indicating that immediately 05/13/24 the staff were retrained on the importance of signing their name on the medication log.  In addition, the staff now have to go through the medication logs within 2 hours to recheck.  In addition, the House Supervisor will also be checking the mediation logs to ensure for accuracy.

Deficiency Narrative: There was not a shower door/curtain on the lower level shower.  The children were having to using the shower on the main floor, which is not where their bedrooms are located.
Correction Narrative: I received an email from the Administrator indicating that they have purchased a new shower curtain and installed it. A picture was sent with the shower curtain installed.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff person was "horse play and rough housing" with the children in care and an injury occurred.
Correction Narrative: Staff were trained on appropriate play with the children.  Children were interviewed and confirmed that they no longer allowed to horseplay with staff.

Deficiency Narrative: Two incident reports did not have the age and gender of all children involved.  In addition, the following was also missing.  All witnesses were not listed, as well as the resolution of the incident was not document.
Correction Narrative: The Administrator sent an email stating that the staff were individually proper trained on how to document serious incident reports. An attachment with the incident report form was sent ensuring all areas that needed to be address were now on the new form.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of the children's service plan required "constant" supervision; this was not followed.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: Two children 13 and 10 years old were left unsupervised by a caregiver in a vehicle and engaged in inappropriate sexual behavior.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver left 4 children in a van without any supervision on 2 occasions.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: There were two employees that had expired training in Normalcy.  The last date the  training was taken was 3/6/22.
Correction Narrative: An email was received by the Administrator indicating that the training has been completed with the staff. The certificates were requested.  A copy of the certificates was received, and the staff did complete the training on 5/23/23.  Also, a copy of the check list that was created to document the training dates.

Deficiency Narrative: Incident reports provide insufficient information on interventions before and after an incident and it does not state who spoke to the child/children in care.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the Administrator indicating that the operation has two different forms, and the incorrect form was used.  A training was completed with the staff and a new form was created to have all required information.  A copy of the form was received.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff did not administer medications to children in care as prescribed by the physician.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: Medications skipped or not filled in a timely manner were not documented as required for all prescribed medications.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the Administrator indicating that a training with the staff was completed on ensuring all medication is filled out correctly. A in person follow up will be conducted the week of 4/10/23. An unannounced inspection was completed with the operation and medication was reviewed. There were no concerns.

Deficiency Narrative: There was mold along a wall in a child's sleeping area.  In addition, there was a broken toilet lid in the children's bathroom.
Correction Narrative: This standard has been evaluated and found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: The count on a medication log that was reviewed did not match the count of medications in the bottle. There were 30 pills in the bottle and there were 27 pills documented on the medication log.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the Administrator stating that the medication forms have been updated to a newer version.  The staff were trained on the new form on 6/12/21.  Protocol for medication routine was assigned to a specific staff to include: ordering, picking up from pharmacy, counting medication in bottle when picked up from pharmacy, reconciling pills in bottle to number of medication log on a weekly basis and monitoring for accurate completion of logs.  An inspection is scheduled for 8/25/21.
